block.p: Alexandra Hamilton Boak, the daughter of Julia Clark Boak of Manhattan and J. Michael Boak of Brooklyn, is to be married today to John Thomas Kelly, the son of the late Catherine and John J. Kelly. The Rev. Dr. Ann Adams is to officiate at the First Presbyterian Church in Sag Harbor, N.Y.

The bride, 29, is known as Sasha. A photographer, she is currently editing a documentary she directed and shot about diabetes in Cuba. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a scenic designer for films in the New York City area. She is a descendant of Alexander Hamilton.

Alexandra Hamilton Boak, the daughter of Julia Clark Boak of Manhattan and J. Michael Boak of Brooklyn, is to be married today to John Thomas Kelly, the son of the late Catherine and John J. Kelly. The Rev. Dr. Ann Adams is to officiate at the First Presbyterian Church in Sag Harbor, N.Y.

The bride, 29, is known as Sasha. A photographer, she is currently editing a documentary she directed and shot about diabetes in Cuba. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a scenic designer for films in the New York City area. She is a descendant of Alexander Hamilton.

The bridegroom, 45, is a construction manager and contractor in the New York area. He graduated from the Art Institute of Boston. His mother taught the second and third grades at the Half Moon Elementary School in Waterford, N.Y. His father was a tool and die maker at the Ford Motor Company's parts plant in Green Island, N.Y.
